eligibility:
Eligibility for the programme is a pass with a minimum of 70% at the +2 level (Karnataka PUC / ISC / CBSE / State Boards) in the Commerce stream from any recognised Board in India.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Curriculum bench marked against global finance and investment certifications Training and mentoring by industry experts Using  Bloomberg for Learning and Research in Finance Experiential learning with Student Managed Investment funds, stock trading Higher Order Thinking skills (HOTS) projects as a gateway to consulting careers Real-world consulting projects & Capstone projects
what_learn: What you will learn? Accounting skills to analyse and manage financial transactions , generate reports enable in financial decisions Take Decisions involving Corporate Finance, Corporate Valuation and Capital Markets strategy Skills , Tactics and Attitudes to successfully trade and invest in stock markets and alternative investments. Analyse and recommend investment opportunities for Investment Banks , Institutions and clients (Equity Research) Higher Order Thinking skills to progress in high end careers such as Management Consulting and Advisory
